awd_titl_txt: Design Principles of Biochemical Reaction Networks
awd_abstract_narration:
Intellectual Merit:
Underlying the biology of individual living cells is a remarkably intricate biochemical machinery that permits the cell to perform complex metabolic functions, to respond precisely to external signals, and to replicate itself faithfully even when subjected to a wildly fluctuating environment. This machinery comprises networks of interconnected biochemical reaction modules, each involving multiple chemical reactions and a variety of distinct molecular species.  Nature appears to employ certain unifying design principles life-strategies that evolved over hundreds of millions of years to tailor the structures of reaction network modules to the cellular tasks they execute. The goal of this project is to develop a comprehensive theory of the relationship between reaction network structure and reaction network behavior, and thus increase the understanding of how cells function and respond robustly to environmental changes. The research requires expertise in biology, mathematics, and chemical engineering and will be carried out by an inter-disciplinary team based at Ohio State University collaborating with a pioneering group at the Weizmann Institute of Science in Rehovet, Israel. 

Broader Impacts:  
Fundamental theoretical understanding of structure-function relationships in biochemical networks will have a broad impact on biological science, with applications in the analysis of specific systems and the design of new ones. Just as electrical circuit theory was key to the development of the electronics industry, an incisive theory of biochemical circuitry is expected to be fundamental for development of the emerging discipline of synthetic biology, which seeks to fashion new and useful devices from biological components. The project will support the education of a graduate student. A widely disseminated computer program developed by the PI to model biochemical reaction networks will be updated to reflect new theory and computing capabilities. It will be disseminated to practitioners in the field and used as a basis for innovative outreach to engage high school and undergraduate students in synthetic biology and molecular bioengineering.

por.por_cntn:
The cell requires specialized biochemical reaction networks (e.g., switches, oscillators) that can underlie the rich behavior necessary for the maintenance of life. However, most chemical reaction networks, even highly complex ones, give rise to behavior that is stable and largely dull. This is perhaps the way things should be: specialized biochemical switches and oscillators should play their more exotic roles against a larger chemical background that is dynamic but yet reliably mundane. The reaction network landscape, then, consists of large regions characterized by dull, stable behavior punctuated by far smaller regions in which reside those reaction networks that might exhibit the richer dynamics intrinsic to life. If we are to understand design principles that connect reaction network structure to reaction network function it becomes important to understand in precise terms those network-architectural features that locate a particular network in one part of the landscape or the other.

                During the course of the grant period, there was, we believe, major success in providing means to discriminate between reaction networks that might underlie certain specific biochemical functions and those that could not, at least when the rate functions for individual reactions reside within a very broad class kinetic class. In particular, much of the work centered on the newly-developed theory of concordant reaction networks. Concordance is a subtle network-structural property. Every reaction network is either concordant or discordant, and, for a particular network, concordance or discordance can be discerned computationally by The Chemical Reaction Network Toolbox, a software tool made freely available on the internet. Concordance largely enforces a kind of stable, dull behavior, while discordance of a reaction network permits the richer more exotic behavior normally associated with life.

            Concordance of a reaction network can also be discerned through inspection of its Species-Reaction Graph, which is a depiction of a network in a diagram reminiscent of pathway charts common in the biochemical literature. Indeed, new theorems connecting concordance of a network to properties of its Species-Reaction Graph indicate just how subtle are the network-architectural features that discordance requires. These theorems suggest that discordance is likely to be less common than concordance across the full reaction network landscape. Thus, the rich behaviors associated with discordance and characteristic of specialized biological networks (e.g., switches) seem likely, as expected, to play their functional roles against a larger chemical backdrop characterized by the dull behavior associated with concordance.

            The grant provided for a rich and varied education of a Ph.D. student, whose work involved development of difficult theory, experiments, and the writing of advanced software.
